Update:My method An elementary algebraic approach to the problem : $f(x-1)+f(x+1)=\sqrt { 3 } f(x)$ Replace $x$ with $x+1$ and $x-1$ respectively. We get $f(x)+f(x+2)=\sqrt { 3 } f(x+1)$ and  $f(x-2)+f(x)=\sqrt { 3 } f(x-1)$ From these three equations we get $f(x-2)+f(x+2)=0$ Putting $x=x+2$ and adding with last equation we get $f(x-2)+f(x+4)=0$....(1) Similarly $f(x-4)+f(x+2)=0$.....(2) Put $x=x-6$ in (1) We get $f(x-8)+f(x-2)=0$.....(3) From (1) and (3) we get $f(x-8)=f(x+4)$ So the period of $f(x)$ is 12
